4.25.22  9:38 pm   Can I ask what the rhythm is in "i'm scared" when you sing "i'm fallin'", right after the "am i scared enough" part?

      it's gotta be a little stretched, but if i were notating it i might say 'fall' is supposed to be on the & of 2, then the next 2 notes (E and F#) are in between beats 3 and 4, and the next 2 notes (A and B) are supposed to be between beats 4 and 1. And then the last 2 notes 'allin' (C and A) are supposed to be on 1 and the 'a' of 1, just the way the other 'fallin's are

4.25.22  8:44 pm   if you can remember, what was the song selection process for "fly around" like? (only if u can say without spoiling future songs ofc)

      i had just thrust myself into a brand new schedule, so i knew i would be extremely tight on time for all parts of the process. i took a walk to try to relax and prepare for the insanity, and i allowed my mind to casually try to recall from memory if there are any songs which might stand out as good choices. 'special sandals' (which was only 8 bars at the time) seemed to cross my mind, because it's one that i'd been fond of for the past couple years since writing. it's one of the ones that keeps persistently popping into my head, in general. so i thought of that one. Normally i would have probably rejected that one on the basis of 'sandals' being too iffy and weird and possibly not strong. Or the fact that it was only 8 bars and i might have preferred to pick something that was a little further along. However, this being a brand new schedule, it seemed like the perfect sort of carefree vibe to pick that one. Of course, being who i am, i had to insist on going through the list properly, so i did. it looks like i came up with 10 finalists, including special sandals. it turns out, sandals was still feeling favored, and got extra points for having visited me earlier on the walk

4.25.22  7:59 pm   What is the tempo of your next song

      94

4.25.22  7:01 pm   What's the breakdown for how much of new canaan was written prior to the trip, en route to new canaan, in new canaan, on the return trip home, and at home after the trip? 

      none of it was written before the trip. during the trip, (may 15, 2009) this entire version was written (page 1 and page 2). the part about harlem was written while the train was stopped at the 125 street stop (harlem). that's where the idea came from. By the time i got to new canaan i feel like i had likely made it to at least the end of the chorus ('every word i say is true'). Some of the next parts were written at the outdoor tables at starbucks, just next to the train station in new canaan. i took a brief walk for a few blocks and may have worked on the last chorus (grey) while waiting for the train and/or on the way back.
     On nov 6, 2012, i made some clarifications to the melody and chords. Decided on the key of D. Did some re-writes, such as "12 figure" instead of 7 figure, and i also came up with the 'license plates' line to replace the line that was there before. The entire starbucks stanza was re-written to be stronger. Also re-wrote the last chorus to be stronger.
     on august 9, 2013 some small melody/chord details were clarified/adjusted

4.25.22  4:30 pm   whats a sus chord?

      Csus4 is notes C, F, and G
      Csus2 is notes C, D, and G
      in contrast, C (which means C major) is notes C, E, and G

4.25.22  2:26 pm   in "im scared" are those things you you said really true? i mean i have alot of fear in my life like asbestos and PFAS and i can kind of see how people could get scared of there own clothes because of stuff.

      the song is somewhat of a portrayal of what it might feel like to be scared of just about everything

4.25.22  12:50 pm   what the actual fuck is a beet

      i don't know

4.25.22  9:11 am   do you make lyrics first, then instrumentals to go with lyrics, or the other way around.

     absolutely not

      If both, then is one more common?

     both is by far most common, but to be honest now that i re-read your question it doesn't make very much sense to me. if you only have instrumentals and lyrics, you'll still be missing a lot.... like the whole melody (pitches) being sung for the lyrics. in any case, the lyric+melody+chords are all dependent on each other so for best results they will all come into existence simultaneously

     also hi :)

4.25.22  7:51 am   how are you so funny/smart

      could be a defense mechanism

4.25.22  5:54 am   do you think its crazy that people are learning about music with your songs like how you have learned about music with other peoples songs?

      not as crazy as if they were learning auto mechanics from me
